/blog/post/2025/11/01/data-structures-al.title: Mastering the Core: Data Structures and Algorithms
/blog/post/2025/11/01/data-structures-al.description: A strong foundation in data structures and algorithms is essential. Here’s how I decided to revisit the fundamentals and turn them into my own DSA course.

/blog/post/2025/04/02/react-native-skia-.title: Creating Stunning Gradients in React Native with Skia
/blog/post/2025/04/02/react-native-skia-.description: Learn how to create stunning text with React Native using React Native Skia. In this post, we’ll explore how to leverage Skia’s powerful features to bring vibrant gradients to life.

/blog/post/2025/03/17/locale-ios-app-dev.title: Which Locale? Decoding the Madness Behind iOS Localization and Language Preferences
/blog/post/2025/03/17/locale-ios-app-dev.description: iOS localization is a wild ride where device and app locales play by their own rules. But don’t worry, after some chaos, Apple’s settings actually matched our expectations. Of course, only after a few twists and turns.

/blog/post/2025/03/01/llm.title: Large Language Models (LLMs): a hitchhiker's guide to their galaxy (for newbies like me)
/blog/post/2025/03/01/llm.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing how we interact with technology. This article provides some entry level knowledge about them. A personal selection of topic needed to understand the basics of them.

/blog/post/2025/01/03/styled-component-t.title: Styled Components: create a type to define transient props based on the props interface of another component
/blog/post/2025/01/03/styled-component-t.description: Standard transient props and shouldForwardProp are styled components API let you filter out props that should not be passed to the underlying React node or DOM element. In this post we will see how we can create a type to automatically define props from the interface of props of a parent component.

/blog/post/2024/12/31/carousel-parallax-.title: Create a circular carousel with parallax effect in React Native
/blog/post/2024/12/31/carousel-parallax-.description: Let's see how it is possible to create a circular carousel with parallax effect in React Native by leveraging the power of React Native Reanimated.

/blog/post/2024/10/21/react-universe-202.title: React Universe 2024
/blog/post/2024/10/21/react-universe-202.description: Let's dive into the talks from React Universe 2024 that stood out to us the most and share the key insights we gained. From innovative debugging tools to cross-platform development strategies, we’ll walk you through what we found valuable and how it’s shaping our approach to React and React Native development.

/blog/post/2024/03/02/react-native-skia-.title: React Native is Native: drawing customized background shapes with React Native Skia and React Native SVG
/blog/post/2024/03/02/react-native-skia-.description: A lot of mobile developer often complains that React Native is not Native, because it is missing some features. This is absolutely not true! In this blog post I will show you how I create a component with a custom background shape, similar to the one I did for a native component ome time ago

/blog/post/2024/01/31/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Santa is stuck! (Day 24)
/blog/post/2024/01/31/advent-of-typescri.description: Santa is stuck! Let's see how I helped him to escape from the maze using the TypeScript type system.

/blog/post/2024/01/20/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Connect 4 (Day 23)
/blog/post/2024/01/20/advent-of-typescri.description: Connect 4, a classical family Christmas game. Let's see how to tackle it with the typescript type system.

/blog/post/2024/01/04/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Tic tac toe (Day 21)
/blog/post/2024/01/04/advent-of-typescri.description: Tic tac toe, another classical kata games you can find at a coding dojo. A game that is simple to implement with functions, variables etc. becomes a real challenge when you try to implement it using only types.

/blog/post/2023/12/30/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: Rock paper scissors (Day 17)
/blog/post/2023/12/30/advent-of-typescri.description: Rock paper scissors, one of the classical kata games you can find at a coding dojo. Can it be implemented using only TypeScript types?

/blog/post/2023/12/29/advent-of-typescri.title: Advent of TypeScript 2023: my personal favourite challenges
/blog/post/2023/12/29/advent-of-typescri.description: This year I participated in the first edition of Advent of TypeScript created by TypeHero. In this new series of article I will show my solutions to the challenges I liked the most.

/blog/post/2023/06/30/swiftui-text-conca.title: SwiftUI and the Text concatenations super powers
/blog/post/2023/06/30/swiftui-text-conca.description: Do you need a way to compose beautiful text with images and custom font like you are used with Attributed String. The Text component has everything we need to create some sort of 'attributed text' directly in SwiftUI. Let's go!!!

/blog/post/2023/01/10/widget-ios-swiftui.title: Widget iOS: how to fix the image bundling problem
/blog/post/2023/01/10/widget-ios-swiftui.description: Discover how we had a long day debugging WidgetKit problems with images.

/blog/post/2022/10/03/swiftui-path-svg-s.title: Use SwiftUI Path and Shape to render your svg files: a practical example
/blog/post/2022/10/03/swiftui-path-svg-s.description: Let's have some fun with SwiftUI by drawing an inspiration title component leveraging Path and Shape.

/blog/post/2022/06/06/microfrontend-modu.title: Create a microfrontend app using module federation and dynamic configuration
/blog/post/2022/06/06/microfrontend-modu.description: We are used to the term microservice in the backend world. Is there a way to achieve the same architectural indipendence in the frontend world? Let's see how it is possible to create a microfrontend app by leveraging Webpack 5 module federation with a widget-based custom remote configuration.

/blog/post/2022/03/02/custom-jackson-mod.title: A custom module for Jackson object mapper using Java Service Provider
/blog/post/2022/03/02/custom-jackson-mod.description: Sometimes you have custom Jackson object mapper imported from external modules/libraries. How can you customize their serialization/deserialization? Let's go to discover the power of Java Service Provider Interface.

/blog/post/2022/01/02/react-detect-scrol.title: A simple react hook to detect scroll direction
/blog/post/2022/01/02/react-detect-scrol.description: How do you detect scroll direction using React hooks? Let’s find out in this new post.

/blog/post/2021/11/05/contract-testing-a.title: Contract testing asynchronous messaging with Pact and MockK
/blog/post/2021/11/05/contract-testing-a.description: In the last weeks I worked with my colleague Felice Giovinazzo on a new feature for the refund process. Let’s see how we used pact to test a message-based interaction between two microservices with Pact

/blog/post/2021/06/06/ddd-dictionary.title: A Domain Driven Design dictionary for newbies
/blog/post/2021/06/06/ddd-dictionary.description: In the last months, I started to hear a lot of stuff about Domain Driven Design. What is DDD? What does it try to solve? This is a post for all the newbies (like me) that are searching for a definition of what DDD is, which are its main parts and what is its main goal.

/blog/post/2021/05/31/swift-linux-test-l.title: How to test your Swift source code on Linux: locally and on Github Actions
/blog/post/2021/05/31/swift-linux-test-l.description: Quick tips (useful for open source projects) for testing your Swift source code on Linux locally and with Github Actions.

/blog/post/2021/03/08/ios-test-multiple-.title: Better organize tests and run them against multiple configuration with Xcode Test Plan
/blog/post/2021/03/08/ios-test-multiple-.description: Recently I added a lot of Unit and UI tests to RangeUISlider, one of my open source projects. Let's see how I grouped them and run them against multiple configurations with Xcode Test Plan.

/blog/post/2021/01/27/kotlin-junit5-mock.title: Unit testing in Kotlin with JUnit 5 and MockK
/blog/post/2021/01/27/kotlin-junit5-mock.description: I recently discovered MockK, a mocking library created for Kotlin. Let's see how it is possible to write modern unit tests with MockK + JUnit 5.

/blog/post/2020/12/23/rest-template-webc.title: Spring Boot + Kotlin Rest client cheatsheet: RestTemplate and Webclient
/blog/post/2020/12/23/rest-template-webc.description: During the last months I worked a lot with Spring Boot backend applications. In this post I explain how you can consume a REST api from a Spring Boot application using RestTemplate and (the new) WebClient.

/blog/post/2020/10/19/swift-package-mana.title: Swift Package Manager: bundling resources with a Swift Package
/blog/post/2020/10/19/swift-package-mana.description: Recently I upgraded my ID3TagEditor swift package to the latest Swift tools version (5.3). During the upgraded I discovered that now you can bundle resources with your Swift package. In this post I will show you how  you can do this, and also an interesting trick in order to be able to build a project as a Swift Package and as a standard project from Xcode.

/blog/post/2020/08/07/webpack-workbox-se.title: Create a service worker with Workbox, Webpack and TypeScript
/blog/post/2020/08/07/webpack-workbox-se.description: Recently I migrated my website to Webpack and TypeScript. I decided also to give a try to Workbox, a set of Google libraries to improve the creation of a Progressive Web App. Let's see how easy it is to create a PWA with this tools.

/blog/post/2020/07/02/expose-uikit-to-sw.title: Use UIKit components in SwiftUI: UIViewControllerRepresentable and UIViewRepresentable
/blog/post/2020/07/02/expose-uikit-to-sw.description: Do you know that it is possible to use UKit components in SwiftUI? Let's see how you can use UIViewRepresentable and UIViewControllerRepresentable to use your UIKit based component or to fill the gap for missing SwiftUI API.

/blog/post/2020/06/02/dynamic-imports-we.title: Lazy loading of JavaScript modules by using dynamic imports and code splitting with Webpack
/blog/post/2020/06/02/dynamic-imports-we.description: Most of the time you have a big JavaScript codebase for your website but you need only a small fraction of it when a page is requested. Is it possible to load chunks of JavaScript code only when they are really needed? Yes you can with Webpack and its code splitting feature based on a syntax equal to the one of ES2020 dynamic imports.

/blog/post/2020/05/20/dark-mode-css-sass.title: Add dark mode support on your website with SASS and prefers-color-scheme media query
/blog/post/2020/05/20/dark-mode-css-sass.description: Dark mode support has been around for quite some time. Let's see how you can create a light theme and a dark theme for your website that will be selected automatically based on the user system preference.

/blog/post/2020/04/19/dependecy-injectio.title: How to: create your SUPER simple dependency injector container in Swift
/blog/post/2020/04/19/dependecy-injectio.description: There are a lot of dependency injection framework in the open source swift world with really cool features like object graph, persistence etc. But what if all you need is a lightweight dependencies container? In this post I will show you how to create it by leveraging the Metatype Type, Generics, the Hashable protocol and the Equatable protocol.

/blog/post/2020/03/06/custom-tabbar-swif.title: Create a custom TabBar in SwiftUI
/blog/post/2020/03/06/custom-tabbar-swif.description: SwiftUI has been introduced by Apple during the last WWDC. I started to use it for a personal project to understand its potential. Let's see how I used SwiftUI to create a custom TabBar with modal and detail navigation.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ti.description: Understanding how algorithm performance is measured using Big-O notation and analyzing time-space tradeoffs.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ar.title: Arrays
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ar.description: Arrays are one of the most fundamental data structures in computer science. They provide a way to store elements in a contiguous block of memory, allowing efficient access and manipulation.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/st.title: Strings
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/st.description: Strings are fundamental data types serving as the foundation for text processing, pattern recognition, and encoding/decoding operations.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bi.title: Bit Manipulation
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bi.description: Bit manipulation (bit wise) is one of the most powerful tools in computer science, allowing direct control over how data is represented and processed at the hardware level.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ha.title: Hashtable
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ha.description: A hash table is a data structure that stores key-value pairs and allows extremely fast lookups, insertions, and deletions, typically in O(1) average time.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/tw.title: Two Pointers
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/tw.description: The Two Pointers technique uses two indices to solve array problems in linear time O(n) instead of inefficient O(n²) nested loops.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/pr.title: Prefix Sum
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/pr.description: The Prefix Sum technique precomputes cumulative information so that range sum queries can be answered in O(1) time.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/sl.title: Sliding Window
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/sl.description: The Sliding Window pattern transforms O(n²) problems into O(n) solutions by maintaining a window over data and adjusting it incrementally.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ka.title: Kadane's Algorithm
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ka.description: Kadane's Algorithm is a classic algorithm designed to efficiently find the maximum sum subarray within a one-dimensional array of numbers in O(n) time.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ma.title: Matrix (2D Array)
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ma.description: Matrix problems focus on navigating rows and columns, managing boundaries, applying consistent traversal rules, and performing transformations on 2D arrays.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/li.title: Linked List
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/li.description: A linked list is a data structure consisting of nodes where each node contains a value and a reference to the next node, enabling flexible insertions and deletions.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/st.title: Stack
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/st.description: A stack is a fundamental LIFO (Last In, First Out) data structure where the last element added is the first one to be removed.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/qu.title: Queue
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/qu.description: A queue is a fundamental FIFO (First In, First Out) data structure where the first element added is the first one to be removed.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bu.title: Bucket sort
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bu.description: Bucket Sort is a distribution-based sorting algorithm that works by dividing elements into several buckets and then sorting each bucket individually. It is particularly effective for sorting numbers that fall within a bounded range or when sorting elements based on their frequency.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/re.title: Recursion
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/re.description: A deep dive into recursion as a problem-solving technique, with practical TypeScript examples.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/me.title: Merge Sort
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/me.description: A deep dive into Merge Sort as a divide-and-conquer algorithm, from array sorting to linked lists and advanced counting problems.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/qu.title: Quick Sort
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/qu.description: An in-depth look at Quick Sort as a divide-and-conquer algorithm, focusing on partitioning, expected complexity, and selection problems.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bi.title: Binary Search
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/bi.description: Binary search is an efficient algorithm for finding an item from a sorted list of items. It works by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half.

/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ba.title: Backtracking
/data-structures-and-algorithms/topic/ba.description: Deep dive into the backtracking technique, a fundamental approach for combinatorial problems, permutation generation, and constraint satisfaction tasks.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Nintendo Entertainment System
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: The Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) was a groundbreaking console that revolutionized the gaming industry with its 8-bit graphics and extensive game library. It saved the gaming industry after the 1983 crash.

/videogames/console/gameboy.title: Game Boy
/videogames/console/gameboy.description: The Game Boy is a handheld game console developed and marketed by Nintendo. It is one of the first successful handheld consoles, known for its portability and extensive game library.

/videogames/console/playstation1.title: Playstation 1
/videogames/console/playstation1.description: The original PlayStation, also known as PS1, was a groundbreaking console that revolutionized the gaming industry with its 3D graphics and extensive game library.

/videogames/console/playstation2.title: Playstation 2
/videogames/console/playstation2.description: The PlayStation 2, also known as PS2, was a highly successful console that built upon the legacy of its predecessor with improved graphics, a vast game library, and backward compatibility.

/videogames/console/playstation-portable.title: PlayStation Portable
/videogames/console/playstation-portable.description: The PlayStation Portable (PSP) is a handheld game console developed and marketed by Sony. It features a large screen, multimedia capabilities, and a wide range of games.

/videogames/console/nintendo-ds-lite.title: Nintendo DS Lite
/videogames/console/nintendo-ds-lite.description: The Nintendo DS Lite is a handheld game console developed and marketed by Nintendo. It is a redesigned version of the original Nintendo DS, featuring a slimmer and brighter design.

/videogames/console/nintendo-wii.title: Nintendo Wii
/videogames/console/nintendo-wii.description: The Nintendo Wii is a home video game console developed and marketed by Nintendo. It features motion-sensing controls and a wide range of family-friendly games.

/videogames/console/playstation3.title: PlayStation 3
/videogames/console/playstation3.description: The PlayStation 3 is a home video game console developed and marketed by Sony Computer Entertainment. It is known for its powerful hardware, Blu-ray disc support, and extensive game library.

/videogames/console/playstation4.title: PlayStation 4
/videogames/console/playstation4.description: The PlayStation 4 is a home video game console developed and marketed by Sony Computer Entertainment. It is known for its powerful hardware, extensive game library, and online gaming capabilities.

/videogames/console/nintendo-switch.title: Nintendo Switch OLED
/videogames/console/nintendo-switch.description: The Nintendo Switch (OLED model) is a hybrid game console developed and marketed by Nintendo. It features a larger, vibrant OLED screen, improved audio, and enhanced storage capacity compared to the original Nintendo Switch.

/videogames/console/playstation5.title: PlayStation 5
/videogames/console/playstation5.description: The PlayStation 5 is a home video game console developed and marketed by Sony Interactive Entertainment. It features a custom AMD CPU and GPU, ultra-fast SSD, and supports 4K gaming.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: RoboCop
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: RoboCop is a beat 'em up game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1988. It is based on the popular RoboCop movie franchise and features action-packed gameplay and challenging levels.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Super Marios Bros. 3
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Super Mario Bros. 3 is the third installment in the Super Mario series, released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1988. It is widely mentioned as one of the greatest video games of all time, featuring innovative gameplay, new power-ups, and a vast world to explore.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/super-m.title: Super Mario Land
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/super-m.description: Super Mario Land is a platformer game developed by Nintendo for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/tetris.title: Tetris
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/tetris.description: Tetris is a puzzle game developed by Nintendo R&D1 for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Top Gun: The Second Mission
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Top Gun: The Second Mission is a flight simulation game released in 1989. It is based on the popular Top Gun movie franchise and features action-packed aerial combat and challenging missions.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/batman.title: Batman: the video game
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/batman.description: Batman: the video game is a platformer game developed by Sunsoft for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/the-ama.title: The Amazing Spider-Man
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/the-ama.description: The Amazing Spider-Man is a action game developed by Rare for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Four Player Tennis
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Four Player Tennis is a sports game released in 1990. It features various tennis events and supports multiplayer mode for up to four players.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Maniac Mansion
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Maniac Mansion is a point-and-click adventure game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1990. It features a group of teenagers exploring a mysterious mansion to rescue their friend.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/f-1-rac.title: F-1 Race
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/f-1-rac.description: F-1 Race is a racing game developed by XYZ for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/final-f.title: Final Fantasy Legend II
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/final-f.description: Final Fantasy Legend II is a role-playing game developed by Square and published by Square for the Game Boy. It features an engaging story, turn-based combat, and character customization.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/nintend.title: Nintendo World Cup
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/nintend.description: Nintendo World Cup is a soccer game developed by Technōs Japan

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/turriga.title: Turrican
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/turriga.description: Turrican is a scrolling shooter game developed by The Code Monkeys for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Mario & Yoshi
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Mario & Yoshi is a puzzle game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1990. It features Mario and Yoshi in a series of challenging puzzles and levels.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/super-m.title: Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/super-m.description: Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins is a platformer game developed by Nintendo for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/the-lit.description: The Little Mermaid is an action game developed by Great for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Barbie
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Barbie is a platform game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1992.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Faxanadu
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Faxanadu is an action role-playing game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1987. It features a unique blend of platforming and RPG elements, with a rich fantasy world to explore.

/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.title: Track & Field in Barcelona
/videogames/console/nintendo-entertainme.description: Track & Field in Barcelona is a sports game released in 1992. It is based on the 1992 Summer Olympics held in Barcelona, Spain, and features various athletic events.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/bubble-.title: Bubble Ghost
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/bubble-.description: Bubble Ghost is a puzzle game developed by Opera House for the Game Boy

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/mortal-.description: Mortal Kombat 2 is a fighting game released for the Game Boy in 1993. It features a roster of iconic characters and intense one-on-one combat.

/videogames/console/gameboy/game/prince-.title: Prince of Persia
/videogames/console/gameboy/game/prince-.description: Prince of Persia is a platform game developed by Jordan Mechner while working at Broderbund.

/videogames/console/playstation1/game/de.description: Demo 1 is demo disc present in the PlayStation 1 console bundle. It contains some playable demos of games released during the console launch.
